page.title: 04Barford Park in Spaxton.
page.content: Barford Park is a large house about 150 years old.It stands in 50 acres of parkland.The house is open for 8 hours per week,and approximately 20 visitors come each week. Inside the house flowers and pictures are on show,including one by Velasquez. Colonel and Mrs Stancomb live in the house. In the gardens a rare 26 year old tree called an Abie Grandis grows to 50ft.high.Two peacocks and three golden pheasants roam the gardens. Three times a year the Pony Club meetings are held in the grounds. Some of the land is rented by a local farmer for sheep grazing. They employ a man for gardening and two domestic helpers. Artists come to paint the house and gardens.A gardening diary is kept by the owner.
